name: AWS Network ACLs with Inbound rule to allow All Traffic
description: This policy identifies ACLs which allows traffic on all protocols. A network access control list (ACL) is an optional layer of security for your VPC that acts as a firewall for controlling traffic in and out of one or more subnets. By default, ACL allows all inbound and outbound IPv4 traffic and, if applicable, IPv6 traffic. Inbound rules that allow unrestricted traffic to the internet can be a security risk. As a best practice, it is recommended to configure ACLs to restrict traffic on authorized protocols.
searchModel.query: config from cloud.resource where cloud.type = 'aws' AND api.name = 'aws-ec2-describe-network-acls' and json.rule = associations[*] is not empty and entries[?any( ruleAction equals allow and protocol equals -1 and (ipv6CidrBlock equals ::/0 or cidrBlock equals 0.0.0.0/0) and egress is false )] exists
recommendation:
1. Sign in to the AWS Console
2. Go to VPC
3. In the navigation pane, choose Network ACLs, and then select the Network ACL
4. Choose the Inbound Rules tab, and then choose Edit
5. Identify the unrestricted Inbound Rule having 'ALL Traffic' type and Source as 0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0
6. Make rule restrictive or either Delete or DENY the rule by clicking on remove icon or DENY the identified rule and save it
